pageContext.claim: “And now you have all of the big — I mean, so many of the big companies, they’ve given bonuses to the people that work for the companies.  That was unexpected.”
pageContext.analysis: In the first days following the tax cut's announcement, some companies announced bonus and new jobs, but the wider impact was slim —with about 126 million full-time workers in the United States, only about 3% have received these one-time bonuses. Plus, a Morgan Stanley analysis found that companies are more than three times as likely to allocate the tax savings to buybacks & dividends than labor compensation.
